keyFactors.title: Workhorse Role Established
keyFactors.description: Judkins emerged as Browns' clear RB1 after Nick Chubb injury, averaging 19.4 carries per game. Kevin Stefanski committed to run-first identity with backup QB Jameis Winston.

keyFactors.title: Jets Run Defense Vulnerable
keyFactors.description: New York ranked 19th against the run, allowing 122.4 rushing yards per game. Jets' defense focused on stopping pass, creating run-game opportunities.

keyFactors.title: Game Script Advantage
keyFactors.description: Browns favored by 3.5 suggested ball-control offense. Cleveland's time-of-possession approach with Winston at QB created 20+ carry environment for Judkins.

riskFactors: Jerome Ford could vulture carries in passing situations
Jets' front seven capable of stacking box against limited passing threat
Potential negative game script if Jets jumped to early lead

quarterBreakdown.description: Strong start - Judkins rushed for 23 yards on 6 carries including 5-yard TD. Browns controlled tempo early.
Browns and Jets battled back and forth. Judkins added 19 yards on 5 attempts. Game remained competitive at halftime.
Jets began to take control. Judkins managed 18 yards on 6 carries. Jets stacked box on majority of Browns' rush attempts to slow ground game.
Final 15 yards on 5 carries including 1-yard TD plunge. Browns lost 27-20 but Judkins finished with 75 yards - 6.5 short.

gameResults.whenMissed: Stuck at 75 yards - needed just 7 more yards to cash
gameResults.gamePace: Browns lost 27-20 as Jets pulled away late. Jets' box-stacking limited efficiency. Judkins got volume (22 carries) but averaged just 3.4 YPC vs 4.5 season average.

whatWentWrong.title: Microscopic Miss
whatWentWrong.description: Judkins needed 81.5 yards and finished with 75 - missed by just 6.5 yards. One more 7+ yard run would have cashed. Got the volume (22 carries) but not quite the efficiency.

whatWentWrong.title: Jets Stacked the Box
whatWentWrong.description: New York put 8+ defenders in box on most of Judkins' carries, daring Winston to throw. Limited Browns to 3.4 YPC as Jets sold out to stop run.

whatWentWrong.title: Goal-Line Work Helped Stats, Not Yardage
whatWentWrong.description: Judkins' 2 TDs came on 1-yard and 5-yard runs. The goal-line work was great for fantasy but didn't contribute meaningful yardage to prop.

statisticalContext.percentileRanking: 38th percentile performance - below average but not disastrous

postGameAnalysis.wasNormalVariance: This was 60% bad luck, 40% analytical miss. Judkins got the projected volume (22 carries) and scored 2 TDs despite Browns losing 27-20. However, missing by 6.5 yards when he needed 81.5 is just variance - one broken tackle or one additional first down converts this easily. Jets' defensive approach (stacking box) was somewhat predictable given Winston's limitations, but 22 carries usually produces 81.5+ yards.

closingLineValue.verdict: Positive CLV - line moved toward over as market recognized Judkins' workhorse role and Browns' run-first approach.

keyTakeaways: Missing by 6.5 yards on 22 carries is pure variance - one additional broken tackle cashes this prop
Jets' box-stacking with Winston at QB was predictable but hard to quantify impact
Judkins' 2 TDs (great for game, bad for yardage prop) came on short runs that didn't help reach 81.5
3.4 YPC vs 4.5 season average shows efficiency dip, but volume (22 carries) was exactly as projected
Positive CLV and correct volume projection - just needed one more chunk play
verdict: Brutal 6.5-yard miss but process was sound. Judkins got workhorse volume (22 carries) with 2 TDs despite Browns losing 27-20. Missing by 8% of the line with expected volume is variance, not analytical failure. Jets' defensive approach (stacking box) limited efficiency but one broken tackle converts. Would bet this spot again with same information.
